{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-190-06-B |Item_parent=Prolonged fever |Item_parent_short=Prolonged fever |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the indication for imaging examinations in cases of prolonged fever |Description=None |Rubric=Additional examinations |Contributors= |Order=6}} ==''First-line'''== o As a minimum: full-face chest X-ray and abdomino-pelvic ultrasound, o Most often replaced by: thoraco-abdomino-pelvic computed tomography (CT) with injection o Trans-thoracic echocardiography if endocarditis suspected o According to clinical context: § CT scan of the sinuses § Dental panoramic § Mammography
==''As a second-line treatment or depending on the clinical context'''== o Cerebral magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) o Positron emission tomography (PET)-FDG (fluoro-2-deoxyglucose) CT (18). '''In children''' '''in first intention:''' chest X-ray, abdominal ultrasound and cardiac ultrasound (to check for complications of kawasaki) '''in second intention:''' Depending on the clinical context - CAT SCAN, - dental panoramic - bone scan - Brain MRI - PET
